info.title: Brightdata API
info.description: Integrate Bright Data APIs to your pipeline and secure high-end scraping precision

get.description: Get a list of cities from a Country
List all available countries per zone type

200.description: OK - Successful request with response body

balance.description: the amount of money in your account

pending_balance.description: the amount of money you will be billed for, as of this moment, in the next billing cycle

get.description: Get the bandwidth stats for all your Zones

parameters.name: NETWORK_TYPE
parameters.description:
Can be one of following: 

 `all`: All network type 

 `res`: Residential 

 `dc`: Datacenter 

  `mobile`: Mobile

zone.description: can be skipped to affect all your zones

get.description: Get a list of blacklisted IPs for a specific Zone

zone.description:
Zone name. 

 **Note**: can be skipped to affect all your zones

ip.description:
can be in one fo the following formats: 

 + Delete a single IP - `ip="1.2.1.2"` 
 + Delete a IP range - `ip="1.2.1.2-1.2.1.10"` 
 + Delete a IP subnet - `ip="10.20.30.40/24"` 
 + Delete a IP mask - `ip="10.20.30.40/255.255.255.0"`

get.description: Get the bandwidth stats for a Zone

ID:.last_value_ts: 2022-11-19T19:1* Connection #0 to host brightdata.com left intact 8:51.546Z

pool_ip_type.description: use in case you want to get the amount of ISP IPs available, the default amount for that API endpoint is data center peer IPs.

ips_type.description:
type of IPs. 

 `shared`: For shared 

 `selective`: For selective 

 `dedicated`: For dedicated

country_city.description: defines the city location of the IPs

domain_whitelist.description:
Space separated list of domains 

 **Note**: for `curl` the spaces should be urlencoded : `d1.com%20d2.com`

geo_db.description: turns on/off using of the IP`s location databases

get.description: Get the total cost and bandwidth stats for a Zone

post.description: Add domain to Zone whitelist or blacklist

type.description:
`whitelist` - To whitelist an IP 

 `blacklist` - To blacklist an IP

post.description: Add Static IPs for Datacenter and ISP

parameters.name: ip_per_country
parameters.description: get the total amount of IPs per country

zone.description:
Zone name 

 **Note**: can be skipped to affect all your zones

ip.description:
can be in one of the following formats: 

 + Delete a single IP - `ip="1.2.1.2"` 

 + Delete a IP range - `ip="1.2.1.2-1.2.1.10"` 

 + Delete a IP subnet - `ip="10.20.30.40/24"` 

 + Delete a IP mask - `ip="10.20.30.40/255.255.255.0"`

from.description: Zone which IPs will be migrated from

to.description: Zone to which IPs will be migrated

vips.description:
IPs to refresh 

 **Note**: If refresh is needed for all allocated IPs, then `vips` parameter should be omitted. 

 **Note**: Only works for Dedicated Residential IPs

ips.description:
IPs to refresh 

 **Note**: If refresh is needed for all allocated IPs, then `ips` parameter should be omitted

get.description: Get live status of Static (Datacenter/ISP) Zone and IPs with connectivity problem

parameters.name: zones
parameters.description: To get attempting IPs to any of your zone: `zones=*`

get.description: Get the available Data center/ISP IPs per Zone
Get all available residential dedicated IPs per Zone

422.description: This endpoint is not available with the chosen zone. Please use it only with active Dedicated Residential zones with allocated gIPs

get.description: Get list of available cities of static network per country

post.description: Switch automatic failover (100% uptime) ON/OFF in a Static zone

vips.description:
IPs to remove. 

 **Note**: If you need to remove all allocated IPs, then `vips` parameter should be omitted.

get.description: Get a list of whitelisted IPs for a specific Zone

zone.description:
Zone name. 

 **Note**: can be skipped to affect all your zones.

ip.description:
can be in one fo the following formats: 

 + Delete a single IP - `ip="1.2.1.2"` 
 + Delete a IP range - `ip="1.2.1.2-1.2.1.10"` 
 + Delete a IP subnet - `ip="10.20.30.40/24"` 
 + Delete a IP mask - `ip="10.20.30.40/255.255.255.0"`

type.description: Zone Type, e.g. serp, isp, mobile, etc.

domain_whitelist.description: Space separated list of whitelisted domains

ip_alloc_preset.description: To set a zone with Shared - Pay per usage type

ips.description: Number of static IPs to allocate to the zone

country.description: Specify which country IP to allocate to the zone, specify this parameter when `ips_type=static`

country_city.description: Country code followed by city (e.g. se-stockholm) - specify which City IP to allocate to the zone, specify this parameter when `ips_type=static`

mobile.description: `true` when adding a Mobile proxy zone, type value must be `resident`

serp.description: `true` when adding a SERP API zone

vips_type.description: specify this parameter when adding a Residential or Mobile zone

vips.description: Number of `gIP` (group of IPs) to allocate to the zone

vip_country.description: Specify which country IP to allocate to the zone, specify this parameter when `ips_type=resident` and `vip=true`

vip_country_city.description: Country code followed by city (e.g. se-stockholm) - specify which City IP to allocate to the zone, specify this parameter when `ips_type=resident` and `vip=true`

zone.description: Zone name. Can be skipped to affect all your zones

ip.description:
`string` or  `array of strings` 

 Single IP, IP Array, IP range, IP subnet or IP mask  

 ### Example 

 - Single IP: 10.20.30.40 

 - IP Array: ["10.20.30.40", "50.60.70.80",...] 

 - Range: 10.20.30.40-10.20.30.50 

 - Subnet: 10.20.30.0/24 

 - Netmask: 10.20.30.0/255.255.252.0 

 **Note** IP array syntax requires quotes `"` for each IP string in array

type.description: `whitelist` to whitelist domain(s), `blacklist` to blacklist domain(s)
